title.native: 焼きたて!! ジャぱん

description:
Kazuma Azuma wants to make bread. Not just any kind of bread, though. He wants to make a bread that represents Japan itself and can stand toe-to-toe with rice as a national food. Thanks to his legendary "Hands of the Sun," unnaturally warm hands that allow dough to ferment faster, Kazuma's bread is like a slice of Heaven.

And when the Pantasia Rookie Competition arrives, everyone will get a taste of his skill! Along with his friend Kawachi (who's only in it for the dough), he’ll go up against koala karate masters, Harvard bread scientists, samurai with rolling-pin swords, and more! Can Kazuma create bread like naan other and bake his way to glory, or should he quit before he's toast?

(Source: Right Stuf)
synonyms: แชมเปี้ยนขนมปัง สูตรดังเขย่าโลก

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

node.description: Bro.Hi, short for "Brother High," is the alias of a former member of the Japanese hip-hop band SOUL'd OUT. He worked as the band's MC along with Diggy-MO' and Shinnosuke from 1999 to 2014, when the group ended its activities. Nowadays, he works as one of the lead singers of the band E.P.O. He is also known by the nicknames "Human Beat Box" and "Japonegro."

Tia (stylized TiA) is a singer from the label Sony Music Japan. She debuted with her single "Every Time" in 2004. Her second single, "Ryuusei," was used for the 6th ending theme of the anime "Naruto."  After releasing one more single ("Negai"), her first studio album, "Humming" was released in December 2004.  Since then she has released two more singles ("Promise" and "zutto zutto…").

Maria (stylized MARIA) is an all female J-Pop band signed onto Sony Music Japan. The band consists of six members. They released their first single on March 8, 2006, titled "Chiisa na Uta". This song is used as the 3rd opening song of the anime Yakitate!! Japan. Also, their single Tsubomi is used as the theme song of Naruto the Movie 3.  

Members: 
Maiko (former ZONE) - Vocals and Bass Guitar 
Aika - Vocals and Bass Guitar 
Reina - Keyboards and Electric Violin 
Tattsu - Drums and back-up vocals 
Ayuka - Electric Guitar 
Sacchin - Electric Guitar

Little by Little is a Japanese rock band, consisting of vocalist Hideco and Tetsuhiko. Little by Little's record label is Sony Music Entertainment Japan and is attached to Stardust Promotion.   The band itself is named for the song "Little by Little" from their favorite band Oasis.  (Source: Wikipedia)

Surface (stylized surface) is a Japanese pop/rock band formed by [Yoshiharu Shiina](https://anilist.co/staff/273901/Yoshiharu-Shiina) (vocals/composition) and [Takao Nagatani](https://anilist.co/staff/273900/Takao-Nagatani) (guitar/composition). Surface debuted at the 1996 AXIA Artist Audition.

SOUL'd OUT was a Japanese hip-hop trio consisting of [Diggy-MO'](https://anilist.co/staff/101708) (MC), [Bro.Hi](https://anilist.co/staff/101709/BroHi) (MC/Human Beat Box), and Shinnosuke (DJ).

On January 30, 2014, they announced on Facebook that they would disband after their final album, To From, which was released on April 9, 2014.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/隅沢克之)

Frequently involved with [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/Sunrise), [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/Toei-Animation), and [Studio Pierrot](https://anilist.co/studio/1/Studio-Pierrot) productions.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/青木康直)

Initially an animator at [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/). Switched to directing in the late '80s.
Representative director of [Aniplex](https://anilist.co/studio/17/). Board Director at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/池田繁美)

Founder and representative director of Atelier Musa.

**[Profile (Office Without)](http://www.officewithout.com/iwasaki.html)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/taque68)** | **[MySpace](https://myspace.com/taqueiwasaki)** | **[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/soundtrack-maker)**

A composer and musician generally known for his jazz-like scores.

When he was 3 years old he was given a piano, he was also taken to Yamaha Music School, where he first came into contact with music. He quit music school as an elementary school student and, until his high school years, studied under Iwashita Tetsuya, who taught him how to use multiple recordings and synthesizers. He became a composer in his later high school years, through the various efforts made by himself and his teacher.

In 1985, he won a prize at the Kanagawa Arts Festival choral composition competition, while in the late 1980s, after entering Tokyo University of the Arts, he studied contemporary music under Satou Shin and Aoshima Hiroshi. While still being a student, he received the New Artist Award from the Japan Contemporary Music Association. He later started working as an arranger after graduating from college.

In 1999, he participated in the music unit "Smart Drug" with Koizumi Hiroshi, who was responsible for doing the composition and playing the guitar, and Okamoto Sayori who would later rename to Hiyoko, who was responsible for doing the lyrics and vocals. He participated under the alias "Taque," where he was responsible for the arrangement and playing the keyboard. They released three CDs from 1999 to 2002.

(Source: Wikipedia)
